title: 302 Categorie 3
explanation:
Incorporation of soil organics:

* improves the filtration and buffering capacity of soil,
* increases the porosity
* increases the soil water capacity, since the water capacity of organic matter is better than that of mineral particles of the soil.
learn-more:
Organic matter affects both the chemical and physical properties of the soil and its overall health. Properties influenced by organic matter include: soil structure; moisture holding capacity; diversity and activity of soil organisms, both those that are beneficial and harmful to crop production; and nutrient availability. It also influences the effects of chemical amendments, fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides.



Source: FAO SOILS BULLETIN 80. The importance of soil organic matter.
